items.title: Trump deploys massive US naval force as Iran nuclear deadline nears

featured_image.name: Trump tells Iran to drop nuclear aims and stop killing protesters to ...

items.description:
President Donald Trump has dispatched a substantial U.S. naval fleet to the Persian Gulf in an escalating standoff with Iran, warning Tehran on Thursday that "time is running out" to negotiate a nuclear agreement or face military action he described as "far worse" than the June 2025 strikes that targeted Iranian nuclear facilities.

The deployment, which Trump has repeatedly called a "massive Armada," is led by the aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln and now includes at least six guided-missile destroyers in the region, with the USS Delbert D. Black crossing into the Red Sea on January 29 and docking at Israel's port of Eilat on Friday. The carrier strike group entered the Middle East region on January 26 after departing the South China Sea earlier this month.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Trump says he's in talks with Iran as US warships mass in Gulf

featured_image.name: Daily Life In Tehran And Anti-U.S. Billboard

items.description:
President Donald Trump has confirmed he is in talks with Iranian leaders while deploying a major naval fleet to the Persian Gulf, escalating pressure on Tehran to accept U.S. demands on its nuclear program or face military action he warns will be "far worse" than last year's strikes.

"I have had, and I am planning on it," Trump said Friday when asked about recent conversations with Iran, adding that he conveyed two conditions: "No nukes. And two, stop killing protesters." Ten U.S. warships, including the nuclear-powered aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln and six guided-missile destroyers, are now positioned within striking range of Iran, according to U.S. Navy officials.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Breaking: Millions more 'Epstein files' released by US government
items.description: More than 2,000 videos and 180,000 images are included in the latest batch, which has been made public six weeks after the legal deadline for full disclosure.

items.title: Djokovic stuns Sinner in five sets to reach Australian Open final

featured_image.name: Australian Open 2026: Novak Djokovic beats Jannik Sinner to ...

items.description:
Novak Djokovic turned back the clock in the early hours of Saturday morning in Melbourne, outlasting two-time defending champion Jannik Sinner in a grueling five-set semifinal to reach his 11th Australian Open final. The 38-year-old Serbian prevailed 3-6, 6-3, 4-6, 6-4, 6-4 in four hours and nine minutes, finishing at 1:32 a.m. local time, to become the oldest man in the Open Era to reach the championship match at Melbourne Park.

The victory snapped Djokovic's five-match losing streak against Sinner, his first win over the Italian since November 2023, and propelled him one match away from a record-extending 25th Grand Slam title that would surpass Margaret Court's all-time mark of 24 major singles championships.

items.title: UN chief warns of 'imminent financial collapse' by July

featured_image.name: UN chief Guterres warns of 'imminent financial collapse ...

items.description:
The United Nations is on the brink of "imminent financial collapse" and could run out of cash by July, Secretary-General António Guterres warned in a letter to ambassadors dated January 28, marking the most severe funding crisis in the organization's 80-year history.

"The crisis is deepening, threatening programme delivery and risking financial collapse. And the situation will deteriorate further in the near future," Guterres wrote in the correspondence, obtained by Reuters.[1][2][3]

The alarm comes weeks after President Donald Trump signed a memorandum on January 7 directing the withdrawal of the United States from 66 international organizations, including 31 UN entities, deeming them "contrary to the interests of the United States".[4][5]

items.title: Ukraine sends youngest recruits to front lines as troop shortage deepens

featured_image.name: Ukraine's desperate need for soldiers spurs exodus of young ...

items.description:
As Ukraine enters the fourth year of its war with Russia, the country is grappling with a deepening manpower crisis that has forced young recruits barely out of their teens onto the deadliest parts of the front line, while units across the battlefield operate at a fraction of their intended strength.

The scale of the crisis was laid bare this month when newly appointed Defense Minister Mykhailo Fedorov told parliament that two million Ukrainians are wanted for evading military service, while 200,000 soldiers have gone absent without leave. The 34-year-old Fedorov, who took over the ministry with what he described as a 300 billion hryvnia ($6.9 billion) budget deficit, called for urgent reforms to address problems "that have accumulated over the years".[1][2][3][4][5]

items.title: Investigation finds Liberia's largest gold miner leaked toxins

featured_image.name: Takeaways from AP report on toxic spills from gold mining in Liberia

items.description:
A joint investigation by The Associated Press and The Gecko Project has revealed that Bea Mountain Mining Corporation, Liberia's largest gold mining company, repeatedly leaked cyanide, arsenic, and copper from its facilities into local waterways at levels exceeding legal limits, contaminating rivers that nearby communities depend on for drinking water and fishing.[1][2][3]

The investigation, based on reports retrieved from Liberia's Environmental Protection Agency after they were removed from its website, documents four confirmed spills between 2016 and 2023 at the company's New Liberty mine in Grand Cape Mount County. Residents of Jikandor village, located downstream from the mine, said they have been forced to reckon with an impossible choice.[3][1]

"If we don't move, we will die," village chief Mustapha Pabai told reporters.[4][1]

items.title: Judge rules out death penalty for Mangione over healthcare CEO murder
items.description: A judge in Manhattan has thrown out federal murder and weapons charges the 27-year-old had faced, saying they are not legally compatible with the other charges of stalking he faces.

items.title: New map reveals Milky Way's magnetic field far more complex than expected

featured_image.name: Scientists reveal never-before-seen map of the Milky Way's ...

items.description:
An international team of astronomers has produced the clearest picture yet of the Milky Way's magnetic field, revealing a landscape of hidden complexity that challenges previous assumptions about our galaxy's invisible architecture.

The new map, created using data from the Dominion Radio Astrophysical Observatory near Penticton, British Columbia, shows that more than half of the northern sky contains intricate magnetic structures rather than the simple, uniform fields scientists once expected. The research, led by the University of British Columbia Okanagan, was published this week in The Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series.[1][2]

items.title: IAEA holds emergency session on Ukraine nuclear safety threats

featured_image.name: IAEA Board Meets Over Ukraine Nuclear Safety Concerns

items.description:
The International Atomic Energy Agency held a special session Friday to address growing nuclear safety concerns in Ukraine, with IAEA Director General Rafael Grossi declaring that the conflict there "remains the greatest threat to nuclear safety globally."[1][2]

The urgent four-hour meeting of the IAEA's Board of Governors was convened in Vienna at the request of the Netherlands with support from 11 other countries—Belgium, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Portugal, Romania, and the United Kingdom. The gathering came in response to weeks of Russian attacks on Ukrainian energy infrastructure that have left millions of citizens without power during winter while threatening nuclear facilities.[3]

items.title: Eurozone posts best year since 2022 as Q4 growth beats forecasts

featured_image.name: Euro zone economy ends 2025 with solid growth despite low ...

items.description:
The eurozone economy closed out 2025 with a better-than-expected quarterly expansion, but economists warn that the surging euro poses fresh challenges for the bloc's export-dependent industries.

According to preliminary data released Thursday by Eurostat, the European Union's statistics agency, gross domestic product in the 21 countries using the euro grew 0.3% in the fourth quarter of 2025, matching the prior quarter's pace and exceeding market expectations of 0.2%. For the full year, the eurozone expanded 1.5%, its strongest performance since 2022 and well above the European Commission's 1.3% projection.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: NASA delays Artemis II test as arctic cold grips Florida

featured_image.name: Cold temps put freeze on NASA moon rocket test

items.description: NASA has rescheduled the Artemis II mission's final pre-launch test due to an unusual arctic outbreak affecting Florida, pushing the earliest possible launch date to Sunday, February 8. The mission will mark humanity's first crewed voyage toward the Moon in 54 years, with Canadian astronaut Jeremy Hansen becoming the first non-American to journey to lunar space.[1][2][3]

items.title: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon arrested on charges related to anti-ICE protest
items.description: The arrest comes after Don Lemon live-streamed a demonstration that interrupted a church service in St Paul, Minnesota, earlier this month that protested President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown in the area.

items.title: Trump nominates Kevin Warsh as new Fed chair
items.description: Mr Warsh will replace current chair Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

items.title: Gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante charged with family violence
items.description: Australian online gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante has appeared in a Perth court, accused of a slew of family violence, drugs and burglary offences.

items.title: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley
items.description: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal Party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley next week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

items.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
items.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: Last-ditch deal sees government give states extra $25b in hospital funding
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to mounting pressure from the states, promising an extra $25 billion for public hospitals.

items.title: More human remains, 'Celine Cremer's jacket' found in river search
items.description: More human remains and a jacket believed to belong to missing backpacker Celine Cremer have been found in a search of Tasmania's Arthur River, police say.

items.title: Djokovic turns back the clock to reach Aus Open final with marathon win over Sinner
items.description: Novak Djokovic will face Carlos Alcaraz in the Australian Open men's singles final after winning another epic semifinal against Jannik Sinner.

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
